label: SIGMI PHI SIGMA AND DELTA MU WIN

resource.chars:
SIGMI PHI SIGMA
AND DELTA MU WIN

SCORE IN OPENING FRAYS
OF COURT SEASON
IN FRAT LOOP >

Victories were rung up by Sigma
Phi Sigma of the national loop and
Delta Mu of the local circuit last
Thursday night in the opening
games of the Inter-fraternity
Basket ball league. Sigma Phi
Sigma had little trouble in subduing
the Phi Sigma Kappa, It! to 8, but
Delta Mu, last year’s local group
champions, found real difficulty in
gaining a 14 to 11 verdict over Nn
Sigma Omlcron. A floor goal by-
Melchior in the last minute of play-
decided the game.
In the first game, Sigma Phi
Sigma was always in the van, and
at half time held a lead of 8 to 4.
The Phi Sigs made a game effort to
overhaul then in the final period,
but the frequent scoring of Miller
and Davidson afforded Sigma Phi
Sigma an easy victory. The work
of Crosthwait for the losers stood
out.
Nu Signia Omicron was ahead (I
to 4, at the end of the first half,
but could not hold their advantage
during the closing period. Melchior
and Longridge featured Delta Mu’s
play, while Sewell and McDonald
were best for N. S. O.
Thursday night Delta Sigma Phi,
last year's title holders, play Kappa
Alpha, while Delta I’si Omega en-
gages Sigma Tan Omega.
Hosier of Teams

are:

bert Murray, Gene Drayton, John
Ray, Pete Heavens, Forrest Coakley,
John Johnson, and Lawrence Bom-
ber ger.

ward Tenney, Paul Triplett, Mon-

wait, Ralph Powers, Herman Reiss,

Joseph Longridge.

well, Merrit Bottom, Egbert Ting-

Donald, Howard Summer and Rit-
chie Taylor.
Sigma Tan Omega Edward
